content: - w a r m h o n e y b e a n i e - a design by aleah nishizaki follow me on warm honey beanie was designed out of instagram my desire for a modern slightly slouchy @knitshizaki beanie the folded brim provides extra warm and a clean look this beanie is easy to customize and modify based on the yarn you already have in your stash make use the hashtag yours one color two or even striped the #warmhoneybeanie final product will be perfect for any knit to show off your worthy person in your life version and see others materials required skills required -longtail cast on and joining in the round yarn approx 80 grams of dk weight yarn -picking up stitches for the color block sample shown i used for a double brim knot house yarns la di da dk in fresh -joining a new ball start approx 60g and bee s knees approx of yarn 20g not including the pom pom -making and attaching pom pom needles 16 inch 3 25mm/3 us optional 16 inch 4mm/6 us -weaving in ends 4mm/6 us dpns for crown decreases *if you do not know notions tapestry needle for weaving in how to do any of ends and eight stitch markers optional these techniques pom pom maker youtube and/or the helpful information staff at your local yarn shop can be helpful resources gauge 24 5 stitches by 36 row per four inches on 3 25mm needles questions abbreviations k - knit cc - contrast color contact me via email at knitshizaki@gmail com or m - marker on ravelry at aleahnishizaki mc - main color sts - stitches set up row using your mc and larger needles 16 4mm cast on 120 stitches using the longtail cast on or your preferred cast on technique switching to your smaller needles 16 3 25mm join stitches in the round *be sure to place a marker at the beginning of the round knit all rounds until length from cast on edge measures 5 inches double brim using your larger needles 16 4mm and starting at the beginning of the round pick up the stitches from the first cast on stitch place it onto the left needle your 3 25mm with all your stitches and then knit the two stitches together onto your larger needle *if you are a visual learner type in double brim knit into youtube and you will find loads of great tutorials the dark blue needle is my smaller 3 25mm and the tan needle is my larger 4mm using my larger needle i am picking up one stitch at a time from my cast on edge placing onto my smaller needle then knitting the two stitches together using my larger needle step 1 pick up the first cast on step 2 place the picked up cast on stitch with larger right needle stitch onto your smaller left needle repeat these 3 steps until all 120 live stitches
